trans-unit.source: Provides the base functionality for writing resources to an output file or stream.
Resource writers are used to write resources to files in a particular file format.
Implement this interface if you want to control the way in which a resource file is written (for example, to store resources in something other than a .txt, .resx, or binary .resources file).

Otherwise, use the default <xref:System.Resources.ResourceWriter> class, which writes resources to a binary .resources file, or the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter> class, which writes resources to an XML resource (.resx) file.
Adds an 8-bit unsigned integer array as a named resource to the list of resources to be written.
The resources are not written until the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method is called.
Name of a resource.
Value of a resource as an 8-bit unsigned integer array.
The name parameter is .
Adds a named resource of type <xref:System.Object> to the list of resources to be written.
The resource is not written until the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method is called.
> [!NOTE] > `value` might have to be serializable, so you might have to provide a type converter, depending on which resource writer is used.
The name of the resource.
The value of the resource.
The name parameter is .
Adds a named resource of type <xref:System.String> to the list of resources to be written.
The resource is not written until the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method is called.
The name of the resource.
The value of the resource.
The name parameter is .
Closes the underlying resource file or stream, ensuring all the data has been written to the file.
If necessary, Close will call the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method to output the resources to the underlying file or stream before closing it.
Writes all the resources added by the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.AddResource*> method to the output file or stream.
Generate does not close the output file or output stream.
Instead, consider calling the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Close%2A> method.
Generate is useful when you want to create a resource file, but you don't want to close the output stream.
Generate can be called only once.
After you call Generate, all <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter> methods other than <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Close%2A> will throw an exception.
